title: Should cats be allowed to roam free at night? | ABC NEWS
description: Every year in NSW it’s estimated that almost two hundred million native animals are killed by domestic cats.  The NSW Greens have introduced a bill to parliament calling for cat owners to be fined for letting their pets roam free.  The government has no plans to punish pet owners, but it has announced millions in new funding to keep cats contained.  Original reporting by Nick Dole. Social version by Simon Greenfield for ABC News Digital.   ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. It's news when you want it, from Australia's most trusted news organisation. title: Courtroom disgust at Hannah McGuire's killer, Lachlan Young | ABC NEWS
description: Lachlan Young attended a pre-sentence hearing for the murder of Hannah McGuire in April 2024 where her family and friends provided 15 victim impact statements.  The court learned that the 23-year-old was planning to leave Young permanently shortly before her death. title: PM raises concerns over 'unsafe' military encounter while meeting Chinese premier | ABC NEWS
description: 00:00 Prime Minister Anthony Albanese raised concerns over a recent and potentially dangerous military encounter in the South China Sea during a high-level meeting at the ASEAN Summit with China's premier, Li Qiang.  He did not elaborate on what the reaction was, but noted that the concerns were "heard".  02:20 Donald Trump has left the ASEAN meeting, looking forward to his meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping.   As the ABC's Global Affairs editor Laura Tingle reports, there probably couldn't be a bigger contrast between the two events. title: Sudden tornado rips through Melbourne's western suburbs | ABC NEWS
description: Residents are still cleaning up and assessing the damage after a sudden tornado tore through Melbourne's west. The storm ripped roofs from houses and even lifted one man off the ground in Werribee. Residents say they were shocked and confused by the tornado and a lack of warning. Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  00:00 - Tornado rips through Melbourne's western suburbs. 02:08 - ABC Meteorologist Adam Morgan explains the storm's sudden onset. title: Senator Price denies involvement in 'coup' to overthrow central land council CEO | ABC NEWS
description: Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price has conceded she knew about a "coup" to overthrow the boss of one of Australia's largest land councils, but denied being "involved" while giving evidence in her Federal Court defamation trial in Darwin.  The former shadow Indigenous Affairs Minister is being sued by the chief executive of the Central Land Council Lesley Turner, over a media release distributed by her office in July 2024. By Olivana Lathouris for ABC News Northern Territory. description: A category four hurricane is heading towards Jamaica. title: US Democratic Senate candidate apologises for tattoo of Nazi symbol | ABC NEWS
description: US senate candidate in the state of Maine, Graham Platner, has been making headlines after a revelation he had a Nazi symbol tattooed on his chest. But Alexander Hinton, director of the Center for the Study of Genocide and Human Rights, says his main concern is still with the right wing of US politics, where apologies over Nazi references and symbols are less forthcoming. title: Hurricane Melissa tipped to bring catastrophic flooding to Jamaica | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Hurricane Melissa is threatening to unleash catastrophic flooding in the northern Caribbean, as the slow-moving system heads towards Jamaica. David Kennedy, a coastal geomorphologist and professor in physical geography, tells The World the island is in the direct path of the system and will feel the full impact when it hits. title: Who wins when Trump meets China’s Xi Jinping? | ABC News Daily podcast
description: Donald Trump is on the move and throwing his weight around in Asia.   But will the US president have the upper hand when he sits down with Chinese President Xi Jinping later this week?   He wants to do a deal on everything from trade to nuclear weapons and he isn't too concerned about China's plans for Taiwan.    Today, ABC global affairs editor Laura Tingle from Kuala Lumpur on why Trump won’t be the most powerful man in the room.   Featured:   Laura Tingle, ABC Global Affairs Editor
